#Text=Plockton
#Text=Plockton is a village on the coast of Wester Ross in the Scottish Highlands , sheltered from the west winds and popular with yacht and dingy sailors .
#Text=Plockton along with Kyle of Lochalsh was the setting for the " Hamish MacBeth " TV series , aired 1995-97.

column1: #Text=Get in
#Text=By train : four trains run M-Sat between Inverness and Kyle of Lochalsh , one on Sunday , stopping at Dingwall , Achnasheen , Stromeferry and Plockton .
#Text=Buses to Skye connect with these trains at Kyle .
#Text=By road Plockton is about 7 miles north of Kyle of Lochalsh , take A890 then branch west down the coast lane .
#Text=Macrae Kintail Bus 712 runs just once in the morning M - F from Corran via Glenelg , Dornie and Kyle of Lochalsh to Plockton .
#Text=It immediately turns round for the return , so it 's no help for day trips .
#Text=The long-distance coaches to Kyle and Skye do n't come via Plockton .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The village is small and pleasant to walk around .
#Text=See
#Text=Plockton Harbour :
#Text=The mild climate due to the North Atlantic Drift allows palm and cabbage trees to prosper .
#Text=You 'll probably see seals .
#Text=Attadale Gardens are 10 miles east on A890 along Loch Carron .
#Text=20 acres of woodland , fern and Himalayan species , dotted with sculptures .
#Text=They 're open April-Oct daily 10:00 - 17:00 , adult £8 .
#Text=Do
#Text=There is plenty of opportunity for hill-walking locally .
#Text=Calums Seal Trips , Harbour Street , ☏ +441599544306 .
#Text=Wildlife watching trips ( weather permitting ) sail daily Easter to Oct , usually at 10:30 , 12:00 , 14:00 and 16:00 .
#Text=The boat Sula Mhor takes 61 , with 35 places bookable .
#Text=Depending on tides it may sail from the car park pontoon or the main pier .
#Text=Adult £12 .
#Text=Lochcarron Highland Games are held in late July at Attadale Estate , along A890 .
#Text=The next event is on Sat 18 July 2020 .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Plockton Hotel : see Sleep listing .
#Text=Shores Restaurant , 30 Harbour St , Plockton , ☏ +441599544263 .
#Text=Coffee shop open year round daily , light lunches Tu-Sat .
#Text=Restaurant Apr-Oct
#Text=The Harbour Fish Bar , Innes Street , Plockton , ☏ +441599544479 .
#Text=Daily 12:30 - 14:30 & 17:30-20:00. Traditional fish & chips , chicken , Stornoway black pudding , etc. Seating outside .
#Text=Drink
#Text=The Plockton Inn also has rooms .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There are several B&Bs ( doubles from £90 ) and self-catering cottages .
#Text=Station Bunkhouse has two six-bed and two four-bed dorms .
#Text=From £18 ppn ; sole use £260 .
#Text=The Plockton Hotel , 41 Harbour St , ☏ +441599544274 .
#Text=Cosy two-star with public bar and restaurant .
#Text=B&B double £130 .
#Text=Duncraig Castle ( A mile east of village ) .
#Text=Hotel in 19th C mansion closed for renovation until spring 2020 .
#Text=Go next
#Text=From Kyle of Lochalsh cross to Skye on the toll-free bridge .
